file_content.text: If the president vanishes, we'll have a long, slow slog ahead of us. Jedi, I need you to get him out of the factory.
I'm going with you. Darth Lachris has lived too long.
Someone who knows the area would be most welcome.
Good, I could use your help.
Need to pinpoint the president's location first. I'll go ahead. Meet me at this position outside.
My task is rescuing the Balmorran president, not an assassination.
Killing her isn't my mission.
Okay. You do one, I do the other.
I don't want you involved. You're dangerous and irresponsible.
The hell you are.
I'll be good. Plus, you need me.
Only I know the factory's defense shutdown codes. You won't reach the president without me.
You can come, but we have a higher purpose than revenge.
All right, but stay focused.
I'll try to remember.
I appreciate your help, Zenith.
You'll be an asset.
You're welcome, Jedi.
Cross the line, and I'll throw you back over it.
I'll be watching you.
Seems fair enough.
Factory's big. I'll go on ahead, and scout. Meet me at this position outside. There's a beacon there; input this code and I'll find you.
I can't be signed into power without a committee of Balmorra's citizens. Sir, if I find you a refuge, would you help me call them together?
S--sure, Mister Cordan! You can count on me!
Be careful in there, both of you. Balmorran Arms is an Imperial stronghold, and Darth Lachris might be expecting you.
[You spot a scrambler discreetly fitted to the terminal.]
Jedi, you're alive! We've been getting reports of explosions near the holding facility.
This line seems secure. First, are all the civilians safe?
They were all free long before the facility blew.
Yes.
Wonderful. We've already arranged hiding places. Where's Zenith? I need to coordinate with him.
We saved the people inside, but Zenith's last communication said he was being overwhelmed.
They're fine but Zenith's not.
Yes, at the cost of Zenith's followers, and maybe Zenith himself.
A lot of Zenith's people died.
I was... afraid of this. I hope he saved--someone's coming.
Should guard your back better, Jedi. Might end up like my people.
You had me worried, Zenith.
I'm glad you're okay.
Save your worry. I'm still alive.
This must be hard for you.
Balmorra will never forget those who died to free her. I swear.
At least the civilians, real Balmorrans, are safe. And we got information.
I could have died in that facility, along with dozens of innocents.
You almost got me killed!
I was killing the enemy. You want to yell, okay, just listen to this man first.
I was in that place, Jedi--if you're looking for President Galthe, I know where they got him.
Is he a captive? Or Darth Lachris's accomplice?
I... don't know, sir. I just saw him being smuggled in and out of the Balmorran Arms Factory by the Imperials.
This knowledge could save Balmorra.
That's valuable intelligence.
I hope so. We just want our lives back.
Darth Lachris may now move the president as a precaution.
But he may be taken elsewhere.
No. I won't let our best lead just slip through our fingers.
A word to the resistance could have saved him sooner.
Why didn't you tell someone?
What if someone had sold me out to the Empire, huh?
Darth Lachris isn't stupid. She'll guess Galthe's location is out. If I were her, I'd move him right away.
